intro: Astragalus georgii, commonly known as George's milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellow to greenish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats, such as sagebrush steppe and grasslands. It has a deep root system that helps it survive in arid conditions. Astragalus georgii is often found in areas with low precipitation and is adapted to nutrient-poor soils.
